page.title: 14INDUSTRY IN SLOUGH
page.content: Slough Trading Estate was established in 1925 on what was known as the "dump". This was an area to the West of Slough where army vehicles from the First World War had been repair3d and sold. In June 1926 the company changed its name to Slough Estates Ltd..The company had received permission in 1925 to lay drains,fix a water supply and electricity(it has its own power station). The estate was the first one of its kind anywhere in the world, with its own banks;post office; health centre and a community centre as well as the large number of industrial units. By 1970 there were 330 firms employing 28000 people.Most of these firms being engaged in light engineering,food or printing. Since the recession of the late 70's some firms have closed down or moved off the estate and many of the units are
